title: Unless You Play  A Hard Carry, Low ELO Is Actually Not Easy to Carry
body: I've played on a S1 account and the games feel like a lottery. One game my top goes 0-12 and basically loses the game, another our bot gets super far ahead etc. Individually, me outcsing and outpressuring my opponent has little impact compared to high gold because teams just feed or get fed so fn hard.  It feels lucky not to get a garbage team. Basically, it seems like low ELO games actually snowball way harder and people also rage way more. It's actually funny because they don't end games fast enough but they give up early so it's almost as if they ended cleanly.

A smurf is just an alternate account. It doesn't have to be Diamond and nor is rank a factor for the definition. However, g2-g1 is night and day compared to s1. The level of the game isn't even comparable - especially for decision making.

If your original account is silver, and your smurf is gold...

Does that make the first account the smurf?
It's only night and day when one of them is your actual skill level. I've played in both those elos on my smurf on the way to diamond; same garbage, different banner.
They won't feel night and day when you are a diamond level player, but they will if you are gold level.

A few things...

It's a team game, you shouldn't be able to solo carry in the first place.  Yes, it happens, even in Master/Challenger, but imo, it shouldn't be possible.

The champs you play likely aren't suited for solo carrying.  You also are likely picking champs that don't work well into the enemy team's comp.  I'd recommend maining a very versatile champ who can do 2+ roles.  Irelia is a VERY good example of this, and I carried myself from Bronze 5 to Bronze 1 in a week with her/Elise (then got hella busy irl and am only Silver 4, almost Silver 3 rn).  She defaults to building at the very least like a bruiser, she outputs a lot of damage, has inbuilt sustain, passive is gorgeous, has true damage to shred other tanks, has point-and-click hard cc, and a moderately low skill floor.  Elise is very similar, except true damage is % max HP damage, which is just as good.

you're very wrong in saying that it shouldn't be possible. Think of any real life sport. Take a bunch of kids (bronze players in league would be similar to this) playing soccer (Football) or american football and add a young teen(gold+)-adult(plat-challenger) to one team. The team with the older person now has a big advantage and that one person will very likely "carry" the game. Same thing applies to league, but it is actually easier to carry in real life since in league your teamates can feed and set you back, while in a real sport the kids would have to intentionally get in your way for it to be too hard to win.

I agree that he's wrong in saying it shouldn't be possible, but check your example:

the kids (bronze) would recognize the teen/adult (gold - challenger) is the best player on the team. They would pass him the ball, they would listen to his advice, they would play the game around him so that he could carry.

in low ELO, the kids (bronze) wouldn't be able to look at the teen/adult and see any difference. They wouldn't listen to him. They would kick the ball away from him, out of bounds, at their own net. Meanwhile, they'd flame him for staying onsides (y don't u go stand right at the net wtf noob) or trying to lead a pass (im standing here y u pass it there wtf u troll). You'd also have to assume that even if the good player has control of the ball, there are 4 other balls somewhere else on the field.

League is harder to solo carry purely due to skill difference than almost any other conceivable sport. Say you're a pitcher in baseball and your opponents can hit the ball 10 ft further every time one of your teammates strike out.

I have probably over 200 Diana maybe even 300 games total throughout four seasons. If Diana is one v five diving your team and not dying right away your team is really bad. I don't mean that as an insult but contrary to popular belief she is in fact still a glass cannon champion. The shield can buy her a few seconds if that but your team should be able to blow her up easily unless you are that far behind. But a full build Diana diving a team that isn't like 20k gold behind should die. You should stun her or all land at least one ability on her and then like one ult and kill her. 

She doesn't get to be like Yi with these crazy tank builds dealing tons of damage. Have I hard carried some games yes. But it was only after getting at least another lane rolling. Also the enemy team not peeling me ever. Shes like Leblanc but with less freedom. I can pop someone but if you group I should never dive and get away with it unless your reflexes/vision control is bad. The second one is Riot's fault though. And if Diana doesn't land crescent strike and goes in Then she should at best kill one person and die.

The problem with low elo, when I was in Bronze- was the fact no one really communicated.

Oh their {{champion:157}} is fed and is the one wrecking us? Better focus their {{champion:48}} instead during a team fight. Hey guys, they have a {{champion:16}} who is constantly healing the enemy ... let's try to kill {{champion:133}} because she's squishy.

You see, not everyone in low elo is like this- but far too often I found people going for the wrong champions during a team fight. They'd either overextend and die, losing us a tower or objective in the process or perhaps they continue to feed without changing their laning style. Diving into the fed enemy laner isn't going to suddenly change in your favor bud.

Although you can 'carry' your team, it is quite difficult. I remember this Gold {{champion:55}} tried everything to help us win the game. She was 15 / 3 / 1 and yet we lost because top lane and jungler fed super hard, and because Katarina is squishy ... she can't fight off the entire team without backup so yea. The guy who played her was very upset with himself, saying in all chat "Why try my hardest when the game doesn't award my efforts?" That still gets to me this day, and I hope he's in Gold or higher because during that game I was in Bronze II

Now i'm in Gold III. Don't give up whoever is still stuck in low elo. If a Support Main like myself can climb out, so can you- especially if you have a hyper carry champion.

I think that's a good point that others have made before but is worth re-iterating:
What it takes to win in high elos won't let you win in low elo. What wins in low elo is different.

In low elo, you win by shitting on your lane opponent and snowballing out of control. If you're not doing that, then someone else probably is (or is at least trying to) which means you only have a 4/9 chance of winning those games (since you're not trying to take large risks and snowball out of control).

In contrast, this very thing would make you lose in high elo. Taking those risks would result in you getting ganked at just that time (as in high elo your opponent wouldn't make so many mistakes to give up solo kills) and you'd be the one feeding and causing your team to lose. In low elo though, people are making those mistakes and you're capitalizing on them and snowballing. 

Meanwhile, what works in high elo (slowly building up a considerable CS lead, an XP advantage, having good rotations to get a slight turret lead, etc...) does still work in low elo but not well enough. Unless none of your allies/enemies are snowballing, it won't have much impact on the game. Snowballing is just so much stronger that someone being 6-0 at 15 minutes makes your 50cs and 1 level lead look pretty meaningless.
